title: Synthetic Recap
body:
BOSTON — On a night where defense and grit defined the Eastern Conference Finals, Michael Jordan authored another definitive chapter in his legendary career, single-handedly dragging the Chicago Bulls to a pivotal 97-87 road victory over the Boston Celtics.

In a game where offensive rhythm was a rare commodity, Jordan was a symphony of scoring. He poured in a game-high 47 points, a staggering figure that accounted for nearly half of his team’s total output. While Scottie Pippen provided crucial all-around support with 15 points and 8 rebounds, the night belonged unequivocally to His Airness.

The Celtics, led by Antoine Walker’s 22 points, fought valiantly on their home floor. Yet, every time they threatened to close the gap, Jordan had an answer. He was an unstoppable force, slicing through the defense with an array of impossible jumpers and relentless drives to the basket. His performance was not just prolific; it was a masterclass in clutch scoring under the intense pressure of the playoffs.

This was more than a simple win; it was a statement. With the series hanging in the balance, Jordan reminded the basketball world of his singular greatness. He didn't just beat the Celtics; he broke their will, carrying his team on his back through sheer force of talent and determination. In the hallowed halls of the Boston Garden, Jordan once again proved that in the biggest moments, the greatest player on the planet is the only stat that truly matters.
